lines.line: You know, I could shock him out of it if I could find some cold water...
Well, I could dump this bucket of water over him. That would sober him up a little...
I think I'll leave it for now.
Hey, Skippy!
What?
Ahhhhhhhhhhgh! That's cold! Are you trying to kill me?
Nope, just sober you up. Memory coming back yet?
No. But I could do with a bowl of tea to warm myself up a bit. Go grab me one and we'll talk.
Any particular type of tea?
Nettle for preference. Just make sure it's hot.
And don't throw it at me!
What's your problem? You're all clean now.
Hey, Skippy!
Gaah! Don't drench me again!
Hey! I only did that once! Try not to be such a big baby!
So what are you here for then?
No real reason. I just thought I would check up on you is all.
Well, I'm still wet, still cold and still waiting on that nettle tea.
Hey, Skippy!
Gaah! Don't drench me again!
Hey! I only did that once! Try not to be such a big baby!
So what are you here for then?
I've come to give you your tea.
Excellent! I was thinking I was going to freeze out here!
Ohhhhh...
What? What's wrong?
Not so loud...I think I have a hangover...
Great...Well, I doubt you can remember anything through a hangover. What a waste of nettle tea...
Hey! A little sympathy here?
Owwowwoww... must remember not to shout...
Look, I do know a hangover cure. If you can get me a bucket of the stuff I think I'll be ok.
Wait... is this cure a bucket of chocolate milk and snape grass?
Yes! That's the stuff!
Ahhh. Yes, I've made some of that stuff before. I should be able to get you some, no problem.
So what is it you need?
A bucket of milk with chocolate ground into it, with a handful of snape grass thrown in on top.
What? Run that past me again?
Take a bucket of milk, a bar of chocolate and some snape grass.
Grind the chocolate with a mortar and pestle.
Add the chocolate powder to the milk, then add the snape grass.
Then bring it here and I will drink it.
The end, and we all live happily ever after. Got it?
Hey, Skippy!
Egad! Don't you know not to shout around a guy with a hangover?
Ahhhhhg...No more shouting for me...
What is it anyway?
I just came back to ask you something.
What?
How do I make that hangover cure again?
Give me strength...Here's what you do. Pay attention!
You take a bucket of milk, a bar of chocolate and some snape grass.
Grind the chocolate with a pestle and mortar.
Add the chocolate powder to the milk, then add the snape grass.
Then bring it here and I will drink it.
Are you likely to remember that or should I go get some crayons and draw you a picture?
Hey! I remember it now, ok! See you in a bit.
Why do they call you Skippy?
I think it may have something to do with my near-constant raving about mudskippers.
That or it's something to do with that time with the dress and the field full of daisies...
Hey, Skippy!
Egad! Don't you know not to shout around a guy with a hangover?
Ahhhhhg...No more shouting for me...
What is it anyway?
Well Skippy, you will no doubt be glad to hear that I got you your hangover cure!
Gimme!
Ahhhhhhhhhhhhhhh...
Much better...
Feeling better?
Considerably.
Then tell me where the mudskippers are!
I wish you wouldn't go looking for them. Those vicious killers will tear you apart.
It's all becoming clear to me now...
I was fishing using a Fishing Explosive...
A Fishing Explosive?
Well, Slayer Masters sell these highly volatile potions for killing underwater creatures.
If you don't feel like lobbing a net about all day you can use them to fish with...
But this time I was startled by what I thought was a giant mudskipper.
What it was, infact, was a...
Dramatic Pause...
A Mogre!
What exactly is a Mogre?
A Mogre is a type of Ogre that spends most of its time underwater.
They hunt giant mudskippers by wearing their skins and swimming close until they can attack them.
When I used the Fishing Explosive I scared off all the fish, and so the Mogre got out of the water to express its extreme displeasure.
With an iron mace.
I take it the head injury is responsible for the staggering and yelling?
No, no.
My addiction to almost-lethal alcohol did that.
But if you are set on finding these Mogres just head south from here until you find Mudskipper Point.
The mudskipper-eating monsters are to be found at Mudskipper point?
Shock!
Thanks. I'll be careful.

characters.name: Skippy
characters.description: Middle-aged male, British accent, slurred and grumpy tone with occasional dramatic flair. A disheveled drunkard obsessed with mudskippers, irritable from hangovers but surprisingly knowledgeable about Mogres and fishing explosives.
